title: Summer
blurb: Dependency and module management libraries are an important part of the JavaScript ecosystem and RequireJS and Browserify are the most popular solutions. Join us to learn what they can do for you.

speakers.title: RequireJS - Chargeur de Module AMD
speakers.name: Thomas Thiery
speakers.synopsis: RequireJS est une librairie qui permet de charger des fichiers et modules JavaScript. Elle facilite grandement la structuration des projets JavaScript. Par des exemples simples et concrets, la présentation nous amènera à voir plusieurs mises en place possibles de la librairie — shim, AMD, node — pour un rapide tour d'horizon.

speakers.title: Browserify - CommonJS Module Loader
speakers.name: Stanislav Venzerul
speakers.synopsis: Browserify is a module management system and the main competitor to RequireJS. Unlike RequireJS, it's based on the CommonJS module loading system popularized by Node.js. This presentation will be an introduction to Browserify and how it differs from RequireJS and the AMD eco-system.
